name: histogram
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a mathematical picture that uses vertical columns of different heights to show ranges of weight, height, time, etc. or frequencies (= how many times something happens). A histogram does not usually have spaces between the columns: A histogram looks similar to a bar chart. Figure 2 is a histogram of the heights of all the children in the class. Compare
bar chart
Nazarii/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesDraw a histogram of the data.Another difference between histograms and bar charts is that in the former the bars have no gaps between them.From the scale on the horizontal axis of a histogram you can see the range of values that the variable takes.

a type of graph that uses rectangles of different lengths, and often different widths, to show the number or rate of something within different ranges: The allocation of labour to activities can be plotted as a histogram which will invariably show peaks and troughs. Compare
bar chart
